p: According to Zammit et al, (2014) the plant parts containing more of the poisonous anabasine complex are fruits and leaves, while roots, flowers and stems contain fewer amounts of it ( Khafagy and Metwally, 1968). This result in agreement with the current findings as leaf extract showed the highest larvicidal effect against R. ferrugineus larvae while root extract showed the lowest effect. Finally, Baldwin and Callahan (1993) explained that N. glauca accumulate nicotine and anabasine in its different parts in order to defend itself against herbivores.
